articles.title: About me
articles.contents:
Hi!
I am a student at the University of Toronto. I’m in the Data Science Specialist Program.
Not much to know about me other than the information on the home page for now. I have many things in the works.

            Bio
            I’m Kevin Wang!
            I study data science at the University of Toronto.
            With my knowledge and expertise, my goal is to help businesses and individuals like myself find solutions to seemingly complex problems. This causes my interests to be broad, from statistics to data structures and algorithms to deep learning.
            In terms of research, I am quite interested in deep learning and have some experience with CNNs and transformers.
            Other interests I have are algorithmic trading/indicators, cybersecurity, and business development topics such as strategy, communication and project management.
            Finally, I’m interested in productivity and personal growth. I want to find general guidelines for growth, that can tie together many techniques and tricks for boosting productivity.
            
            
            Experience
            Neobi Technologies | Jr Data Scientist/Analyst | May 2022-Aug 2022
            
            
            Projects
            Game AI using supervised imitation learning
            Trained a convolutional neural network to play the popular video game, Temple Run 2. The network imitates human behaviors to achieve high scores.
            
            
            Predicting video game outcomes with Random Forests
            Created a classification model that predicts match outcomes of the popular video game, League of Legends, with ~82% testing accuracy.
            Data is hand-collected and carefully processed. Writeup can be found here
            
            
            Education
            University of Toronto | Toronto, ON GPA 3.95/4.00
            Data Science Specialist | September 2020 - May 2024

articles.title: Projects
articles.description: Selected projects in R and python.
articles.contents:
Contents
Game AI using supervised imitation learning
Car prices data exploration
Predicting video game outcomes with Random Forests
Course Review System Project
Edworthy web scraping project
House prices linear regression project

Game AI using supervised imitation learning


Trained a convolutional neural network to play the popular infinite runner “Temple Run 2,” by Imangi Studios.
Explored efficient network architectures, different methods of data collection and methods of combatting overfitting in order to produce a generalizable model that can generate impressive in-game scores.
Data is hand-collected, using a program created in python.
A short writeup of methods and results can be found here
Car prices data exploration
Buying a car is stressful. However, not all cars are built equally and, from personal experience, many car salesmen will not eagerly disclose these inequalities.
I investigated the used car market in the GTA area, and created a website and pdf report for my findings.
Website can be found here
Predicting video game outcomes with Random Forests
Created a classification model to predict match outcomes of the popular game, League of Legends, with ~82% accuracy.
Web scraped the popular aggregator site, LeagueOfGraphs.com, and collected data from the official Riot Games API.
Used python libraries such as numpy, pandas, matplotlib and sklearn to process and visualize the data, and to fit a model.
Used a Random Forest Classifier to create a model with 82% Accuracy. More details about exploratory data analysis, visualization and model creation can be found here
github repository
Course Review System Project
Command line tool that allows users to login, view, comment on and rate courses. Built in Java, this application follows SOLID principles and Clean Architecture, and uses software design patterns to implement many features. This was the final project for my Intro to Software Design class at U of T.

github repository
Edworthy web scraping project
A bot that looks at google search results and tells me when parks are empty, so that I can go on walks. Uses BeautifulSoup and discord.py in python.

Google results(left) gets translated to a Bot notification(right)
github repository
House prices linear regression project
Predicting house prices in Ames, Iowa. This was a data science challenge on Kaggle. Used data cleaning and linear regression techniques to score in the top 15 percent of participants.
github repository
